definitions.definition: The fact of being finished or perfected ; completeness .
definitions.dating_raw: Attested from the mid 16 century until the 17 century.

definitions.definition: The characteristic of being absolute in nature or scope .
examples: the absoluteness of his sovereignty, the absoluteness of his convictions

definitions.definition: Absolute authority , unlimited power; absolutism , despotism .
The fact of being without qualifications or conditions; certainty , unconditionality.

main_definition: ( obsolete ) The fact of being finished or perfected ; completeness . [Attested from the mid 16 century until the 17 century.]
secondary_definitions: The characteristic of being absolute in nature or scope .
Absolute authority , unlimited power; absolutism , despotism . [First attested in the 16 century.]
The fact of being without qualifications or conditions; certainty , unconditionality. [First attested in the 17 century.]
Independent autonomy . [First attested in the 17 century.]
